Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior surface has flaked away in many places, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394348) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394348)
